alert.note: Alert for Interstate 5 Corridor; Northern Ventura County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 03 at 2:59AM PST until January 04 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Moderate snow expected. Gusty winds up to 55 mph. Total snow accumulations from around 1 inch at 4000 feet up to of 3 to 5 inches above 5000 feet. Northwest winds will increase to 20 to 35 with gusts up to 55 mph. Isolated to 65 mph possible on favored peaks and foothill locations. * WHERE...The Los Angeles and Ventura County mountain areas along the Interstate 5 Corridor. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult, with potential for delays and closures. Interstate 5 near Tejon Pass could see snow, ice, and gusty winds, which could cause significant travel delays. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels near 5000 feet this morning will lower to 4000 to 4500 feet late this afternoon and into tonight.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions from CalTrans are available by calling 1 800 4 2 7 7 6 2 3.

area.areaDesc: Interstate 5 Corridor; Northern Ventura County Mountains
